meanings.definition: The practice of telling a news story through photographs.
meanings.sent1: In photojournalism, photographers capture important events with their cameras.
meanings.sent2: She studied photojournalism to learn how to report news using pictures.
meanings.sent3: The photojournalism class had a fun assignment to photograph everyday objects as breaking news.
meanings.sent4: Her photojournalism skills were a powerful tool in revealing the truth behind the headlines.
meanings.sent5: The impact of photojournalism can be seen in the emotional stories captured through images.

meanings.definition: The profession or field of journalism that focuses on using photographs to document news events.
meanings.sent1: Photojournalism requires a keen eye for capturing newsworthy moments.
meanings.sent2: Many newspapers rely on photojournalism to visually represent current events.
meanings.sent3: The photojournalism team won an award for their creative coverage of a local festival.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to photojournalism made her a respected figure in the field of journalism.
meanings.sent5: The power of photojournalism lies in its ability to convey stories through images.

meanings.definition: The art or practice of capturing and presenting news stories through visual storytelling.
meanings.sent1: Through photojournalism, stories are told using powerful images.
meanings.sent2: The museum showcased a collection of photojournalism pieces depicting historical events.
meanings.sent3: The photojournalism exhibit at the gallery was a colorful display of current affairs.
meanings.sent4: His passion for photojournalism shone through in every photograph he took.
meanings.sent5: The essence of photojournalism is to convey narratives through visual storytelling.
